questions.question: He owns a car ................................ a bike.
questions.description: Use either as well as or and here.

questions.question: He developed a Canadian accent .............................. his stay in Canada.
questions.description: Use during when we are talking about the whole of a period.

questions.question: His success is largely ............................... his hard work.
questions.description: We do not normally use owing to after a form of be.

questions.question: The night was ................................ dark that I could not see anything.
questions.description: The conjunction so..that... expresses cause and effect.

questions.question: Someone broke into their home .................................. they were holidaying in Venice.
He opened the garage .............................. took his things out.
.................................. his illness he could not attend the party.
questions.description: All of these expressions mean the same.

questions.question: I was working on a new project ............................... last summer.
questions.description: We use during when we are talking about the whole of a period.

questions.question: She was ............................... upset that she started crying.
I befriended a lot of Americans ................................. I was holidaying in Chicago.
I befriended a lot of Americans ………………………… my holiday in Chicago.
